ai-ud4.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud4.7:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight. He was of few wishes, content, secluded, aloof, energetic, dedicated to the higher mind.
ai-ud4.7:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud4.7:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud4.7:4.1_0: A sage of higher consciousness, diligent,
ai-ud4.7:4.2_0: training in the ways to sagacity:
ai-ud4.7:4.3_0: there are no sorrows for such a one,
